_header: On holy hills which beth of great renown
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Gloriosa Dicta sunt de Te’ (The Virgin Mary likened to the New Jerusalem) — twenty-nine 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

CamTCC600.First Lines:
On hooly hilles wheeche beoþe of gret RenounReysed on heght
                    frome þe valeys loweI saughe þe grounde and þe
                    foundacionOf a Cyte aboue þe Reynebow…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Whane we passe hens by mercy make vs dwelleWhere glory and
                    thinges be sayde and song of þee
CamTCC600.Attributed Author:
Lidegate daun Iohn þe Munk of Bury (p. 1); Balade of oure ladye by
                    Lidegate (added by later hand, p. 1)
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Loo my freendes here beginneþe þe translacyoune out of latyne in
                    to englisshe of Gloriosa dicta sunt de te & c. translated by Lidegate
                    daun Iohn þe Munk of Bury at þinstaunce of þe Busshop of excestre
                    in Wyse of Balade beholdeþe and redeþe I prey yowe (p. 1); a Devoute
                    songe made by Lydegate Of oure Ladye (RT); Balade of oure ladye by Lidegate
                    (added by later hand, p. 1)
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 315-23.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
On holly hylles whyche beoth of gret renounreysed on hyght from the
                    vales lowe…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…whan we passe hens by mercy make vs dwellwher gloriouse
                    thynges be sayd and songe of the
BLAdd29729.Attributed Author: lidgate dane Iohn the munke of bury (f. 146v)
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Loo my frendes here beginneth the translacyoune out of latine in to
                    engelyshe of gloriosa dicta sunt de te & translated by lidgate dane
                    Iohn the munke of bury at thynstaunce of the bushope of excestre in wyse of a
                    balade beholdeth and redethe I preye yow (f. 146v)

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[I?]N holy hillis whiche bien of grete RenounRysed on heyght from
                    the valeys lowe…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…And descende into thy tabernacleHow glorious thynges
                        bien sunge and seyde of the
BLAdd34360.Note:
Follows a heading copied from Shirley; lines 1-40 only; lines 25-40
                    crossed out with an ‘X’. Following recto and verso left blank and
                    skipped in the modern foliation.
BLAdd34360.Attributed Title:
Lo my freendis here bigynnyth the translacioun of of latyn / in
                    to Inglyssh of Gloriosa dicta sunt de te & cetera Translated / by
                    lidgate Dan Iohn Monke of Bury At the Instaunce of þe / Bisshoppe of
                    Exetere in Balade wise biholde and Rede I prey yow (f. 57)
